item.title: Bins blocking pavement, 6th November
item.description:
The pavement outside the block of flats is blocked all week by peoples bins, forcing us to use the grass verge or walk in the road. they shouldn't be left there when it isn't bin day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Slabs sticking up, 6th November
item.description:
Slabs sticking up and getting worse posing a trip hazard now with less day light . This is a busy route to Bromley South station

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Elmfield Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unleashed and unmuzzled XL bully, 6th November
item.description:
I see a middle aged man (white, balding, 50's) walking a tan/brown XL bully along broomwood avenue and up palewell close. this dog never has the required muzzle and is not always on a lead. being a dangerous breed it makes us feel very unsafe and always have to be sure he's not walking it when we go out with our child. we see him walking it most days sometimes more than once a day. when it is on lead it is also pulling the man down the road, he wont be able to control it if it wants to attack someone. something needs to be done to protect the children here
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-Tipped Tyres Abandoned on Pavement, 6th November
item.description:
Several tyres have been dumped on the pavement along St Maryâ€™s Avenue, BR2. They are obstructing pedestrian access and creating an eyesore. This appears to be an instance of fly-tipping and should be removed promptly to keep the area safe and tidy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Mary's Avenue, Shortlands, London
